ATTENTION BROADCASTING STATION MANAGER
Dear Sir:
Some misinformation has boon published concerning tho connection of the
National Committee on Education by Radio with the North and Central American
Radio Conference held recently in Mexico City.
The following original documents will give you the real facts in the case:
1. "Conference Increases International Difficulties", by our
Counsel, who was in Mexico City during the Conference. We are
sending you the September 28, 1933 issue of Education by Radio
in which this was the leading article.
2. Supplementary report by our Counsel concerning his activities
before and during the Conference. (A mimeographed report.)
3. "Financial Aspects of Radio Broadcasting", a mimeographed
report compiled from information published both in Education by
Radio and in the Congressional Record and filed with the Federal
Radio Commission and other Governmental agencies in 1932. This
report was distributed on July 27th to the Governmental delegaÂ¬
tions in Mexico City whose members had not had an opportunity
to see it in 1932.
The National Committee on Education by Radio, in accordance with its desire
to increase educational broadcasting and raise radio standards generally, is
glad to make those reports available to you. Your comments will be appreciated.
